title: Rare, two-headed rattlesnake found in New Jersey forest
text:
PEMBERTON TOWNSHIP, N.J. (AP) - It looks like something from a science fiction movie.

A newborn two-headed timber rattlesnake has been found in New Jersey’s Pine Barrens. The snake has two brains and each head acts independently of the other.

Two employees of Herpetological Associates of Burlington County spotted the reptile in a nest where a timber rattlesnake was giving birth late last month.

CEO Bob Zappalorti tells NJ Advance Media it’s the only two-headed timber rattlesnake ever found in New Jersey. He says it likely wouldn’t be able to survive in the wild because its head could get snagged on something.

Herpetological Associates will care for the snake.

___

Information from: NJ Advance Media.
